pages.text: Redbone Coonhounds only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the S Locus. This gene will determine how dark and richly colored their fur is.

The S Locus has two potential alleles, the incompletely dominant 'S' and 's' alleles. The 'S' allele creates lighter, duller fur, while the 's' allele creates darker, richer fur. Dogs with two copies of the 'S' allele have brown fur, while dogs with two copies of the 's' allele have dark red fur. Dogs with one copy of each have a more medium red coloration to their fur.
pages.title: S Locus
